column4: Has anyone had any luck setting up a VPN on their home network? I want to be able to connect to a machine running Ubuntu Lucid server over VPN.
i have
using openvpn
is that F/OSS?
F/OSS??? CalicoJack
Free and Open Source Software
yea you are correct tjkent
yes openvpn is free and open source
the thing to know is if you plan to run vpn on your home server it helps to have a static IP address instead of dynamic
no i was saying it'd be an issue if her were moving large files
i agree with that
however not all systems can read other filesystems... and for his use it didnt sound like he was gonna be storing large files
Not an issue, I'm going to be using it for a Minecraft server, so I'll just give my IP to my friends when we want to play. If it changes, no big deal
are you using a dedicated server?
yep
Ubuntu Lucid Server edition
calicojack ok then u shouild be fine to use openvpn
everyone will need the openvpn client which is included with the instuctions and package and they will all need a user account on the server
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/OpenVPN
thanks for getting me started, I think the documentation can take me the rest of the way :-)
thsoe are for an older server release but SHOULD work for you
if you have issues CalicoJack you can also get help in #openvpn
thanks, that helps a lot!
